cooking_method:
1. Cook pasta according to package directions. 
2. In a food processor, combine basil, pine nuts, garlic, and olive oil until smooth. 
3. Toss cooked pasta with pesto and top with grated parmesan cheese.

1. Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C). 
2. Roll out pizza dough and place on a baking sheet. 
3. Spread tomato sauce over dough, leaving a 1-inch border. 
4. Top with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil. 
5. Drizzle with olive oil. 
6. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

1. Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. 
2. Brown ground beef and onion in a large skillet. 
3. Add tomato sauce to the skillet and simmer for 10 minutes. 
4. In a separate bowl, mix ricotta cheese with 1 cup of mozzarella cheese. 
5. In a 9x13 inch baking dish, layer noodles, meat sauce, and cheese mixture. 
6. Repeat layers and top with remaining mozzarella cheese. 
7. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30-35 minutes.

1. In a large pot, heat chicken broth and keep it warm. 
2. In a separate saucepan, sauté onion in butter until softened. 
3. Add arborio rice to the saucepan and stir to coat. 
4. Add white wine and stir until absorbed. 
5. Add chicken broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed before adding more. 
6. Continue this process until rice is cooked and creamy. 
7. Stir in grated parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

1. Slice tomatoes and mozzarella cheese. 
2. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate. 
3. Sprinkle with fresh basil leaves. 
4. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. 
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). 
2. Pound chicken breast until thin. 
3. Coat chicken in flour, then dip in beaten eggs, and coat in bread crumbs. 
4. Place chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through. 
5. In a separate pan, heat marinara sauce. 
6. Place cooked chicken in an oven-safe dish and top with marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and parmesan cheese. 
7. Bake for an additional 10-15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
